lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was good! Really nice. Some good flavor on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But, yeah! So, first and foremost, I wanted to give a big thanks and shout-out to Syrinscape, I mentioned them in last week's game, I put together my gaming playlists on their platform, and I'm going to be trying them out tonight to make sure everything works out cool, but their setup is fantastic and I'm really excited about being able to overlap audio, and things fade in and out. If you haven't checked it out, and you want to really amp up your tabletop gaming, it's phenomenal. But they're not paying for this, I'm really excited about it. So that's that, Syrinscape's awesome. Marisha, you want to talk about Signal Boost?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! The first epil-- episode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Epilsode!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The first epil, of--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Epilay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Epil, epilay, epilogue. The first episode of Signal Boost went live on Tuesday. Go check it out on GeekandSundry.com. Go watch it, it's good fun. And you should go watch it so we don't get cancelled, and we'll keep making more episodes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that how it works?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Apparently!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's the weirdest thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's crazy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They care about that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. And I talk about Rat Queens, in it, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! I saw! It's so good, Marisha. It's really funny.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like ten minutes of your-- you have more minutes than two minutes, spend a couple of minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I tell you about cool things that I like. That I picked out myself. My favorite things. Done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This past week there was a terrible gas explosion in Seattle, you may have seen on the news, and it did a lot of damage to that vicinity, including Fearless Ideas, and they've had to cancel a bunch of their stuff, and they're trying to get things repaired and going. So all of our donations this evening will be going towards them and helping them get that effort taken care of. So think good thoughts and help out if you can. Let's see.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Love you, Seattle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 826. We've, next Friday, in Anaheim, at WonderCon, Friday night, we'll be doing a Critical Role panel, from 7:00 to 8:00pm, in Room 515A.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, are we supposed to be at that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next Friday. Next Friday. But most of us will be there for that panel. We'll be doing a Q&A, answering questions, talking about the show, for all the folks that are local or coming to that convention in the Anaheim area of southern California. So, look forward to seeing you there, next Friday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, that's when we-- I can't say. I'll talk to you guys afterwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. We'll go over that. Mystery-- secret, I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Secret, secret.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wanted to give another shout-out to Dwarven Forge again, I mentioned them last week. You got to get a glimpse of some of the map stuff they gave us here at Critical Role to help improve our battle mats and scenarios on occasion. Their new Castle Builder Kickstarter is phenomenal, and if you're looking to do big structures and cool castle-based ramparts and parapets and everything, go check it out, it might be right up your alley.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So pretty. It's so pretty. Also, Laura, if you want to announce, we have some new merch up in the store!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I've been so excited about this shirt coming out, I can't wait to wear it, why aren't we wearing it right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Gilmore voice) "Don't worry. Trust me, it's a fabulous shirt. Some would even say it's quite "glorious."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, oh my god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As well as the Gilmore's Glorious Goods t-shirts, we also have exclusive Critical Role d20 rings, spinny rings. Those are limited, so if you get them, then snag them fast, because they're going to be gone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We get one of those before they disappear, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they said they were going to set us aside some, they'd better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They are. They're bitchin'. You spin it, the 20 is the Critical Role logo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't we have them right now?! At intermission, maybe we can grab them at intermission.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're sick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For those who don't know what those are, the d20 spin rings, or spin rings in general, they're actually two separate moving pieces with ball bearings on the inside, and you have all numbers one through 20 on the actual ring, and you can spin it with your finger, and it acts like a die roll!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the d20, when you crit succeed, it's a Critical Role logo. Just putting that out there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can do all your life decisions based off a ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You still can die from them, though, just to be clear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll a one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we are not held responsible if that happens.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You go straight to Craven Edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's appropriately called a "die."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wanted to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, a quick shout-out for our neighbor, Ivan van Norman's Kickstarter, The ABCs of RPGs, has three days left. I backed it immediately, because I like D&D and I have kids, and you put those two things together and good things happen. So that's good, three days left. Also, hey, if you like to put your dice in boxes, I tell you what. Wyrmwood Gaming make beautiful boxes, and if you go over to their site and you use the code critrole.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Crit. Role.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There it is. You get free shipping, they're beautiful, they have all different kinds of woods to put your dice inside. Is there anything else? Oh, yeah! Oh, okay. Yeah, hey, some of us, not all of us, are going to be going up to San Fran later this month to make appearances on GameSpot's show The Lobby for a couple of segments, and then, also then hopping over to hang with the guys at Kinda Funny to play D&D.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those guys are stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, a few of us will be running a quick little one-shot game I'll be running with the aid of one of their local gentlemen. And it should be a ridiculously ridiculous time! And it'll be a lot of fun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm curious to see, because there's going to be two DMs, in sort of a Batman and Robin-type relationship kind of thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah. We got plans. I've co-DM'd before, it can be very interesting. And very chaotic. I'm excited.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Going to kill everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This has nothing to do with announcements, but I want to only roll green dice tonight. For Saint Patrick's Day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good idea, I've got a set of green dice. I'll get them out. Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's stupid. I have gray-ass dice and a blue one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got to get them all out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is technically light green, guys, by the way, just so you're aware. Cool. Just making sure we're all cool on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus the underwear you're wearing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shh, that's just for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Travis and I are wearing green snake shirts, because (Irish accent) Saint Patrick drove the snakes out of Ireland, into Burbank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drove the Slytherin from Ireland. He got rid of them all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I took the Floo network.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I got this in Ireland, so it counts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It kind of counts, Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It counts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Irish accent) It's fucking Irish wool!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And this is green.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, made from real Irish cats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are the best, aren't they? Last but not least, unless anyone else has any other announcements to make, anything else?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! I got a quick one, Book of Murder came out today, so you can hear me do a very weird accent, it's great. So. Yes. Very weird accent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I'm excited! We made his character this past Monday, and it should be a lot of fun. He's actually fun to game with. We've played D&D a couple times, and he'll be a good addition to the team for his brief stop by. So next week, come check him out on our show!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-oh, what does that mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So thanks for coming, Chris. I don't know, it'll be fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cleric, is what it means.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hoping every guest is a cleric. Just in case.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Save us! From ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, then. Without further ado, unless you guys have anything else, we'll go ahead and hop into a quick synopsis of where we are in Critical Role.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit. Help. Help. Help. Help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam will be here shortly, guys, don't freak out. He's dealing with children and traffic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not at the same time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Children and traffic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Where we left off. The party of Vox Machina, having to deal with the current terrible danger of the Chroma Conclave, a collection of very dangerous dragons that have torn through the entire Tal'Dorei countryside, have then gone on this quest to collect allies, and find these items called the Vestiges of Divergence, these artifacts of ancient wars that carry great power and seem to be the best way you could prepare yourselves for going up against these terrifyingly powerful entities. In searching for this, you went and made your way to Vasselheim, where you reacquired and reestablished friendships with Zahra and Kashaw, two allies from previous instalments of our wondrous adventure, as well as getting Lady Kima on loan from the Platinum Sanctuary of Bahamut, and you all went to seek the first bit of information you discovered about one of these vestiges, not too far from Vasselheim. The champion of the Raven Queen's armor that had been entombed within this temple that had sunken beneath a lake. After traveling to this lake, finding your way through this subterranean, watery location, you found the location of the tomb, upon which, a series of fish creatures, called kuo-toa, had seemingly been worshiping another denizen of this temple, a rather strange slime-covered beholder, that then surprised the party. The battle hard-fought, you came out victorious, and upon going to retrieve your spoils, a trap was set off in the tomb, dodged by one, survived by a bear, and claimed the life of our beloved Vex'ahlia. After a resurrection ritual attempted by Kashaw, the party helping, they were successful in bringing her soul back from the other side, restoring her to life, and the party then, figuring out what their next step in their journey was, took their new allies, via Keyleth's Teleportation via Plants spell, back to Whitestone, which seems to be building as this defensive bastion, this currently not on the radar of the Conclave location that needs defenses, and a good place to keep your allies at the time. And that was where we left off, as you guys had just stepped back into Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We haven't actually slept yet, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's late.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say through the evening's travels-- Well, you guys slept all night the night before you went to the temple, the temple's probably been--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true, we did sleep, actually, we camped out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember? You talked to Zahra, and I talked to Kash? Then we slept.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys did camp out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I didn't know if we camped, I thought we talked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You talked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We at least chilled. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the sake of the current setting, you've come in in a rather overcast mid-afternoon in Whitestone, you may have spent some time there gathering yourselves as your allies scope out their new surroundings, the people of Whitestone accepting you as you arrive, you can always see people walking by and catching a glance at the group of heroes known as Vox Machina that helped liberate them from the oppressive Briarwoods not long ago.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keep crawling out of trees.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's always weird. Not crawling out of trees, that people like us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we inspect our spoils?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say, we should take the armor and the necklace to the castle and have it inspected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Lady Allura here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima, who is with you, is like, "Is she?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Well, she was on her way to Westruun, and we haven't heard from her yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Haven't heard from her since-- You say Westruun was under attack as well?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but she knew it. She was going in secret.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That prideful woman." She slings her hammer off her shoulder and slams it to the ground and says, "Well. If she doesn't arrive in the next few hours, I'm going to gather a party and we're going "to go to Westruun and find her."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kima-- Wait, what? Why?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, there's a dragon there, Kima, a very large one, and she was being very, very stealthy--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her hammer slams into her metallic armor, and she goes, "I've a much bigger dragon backing me up." And she looks up to the sky for a second and grins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lady Kima don't give a fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll wait, Kima.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (frustrated sigh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Going in loud will only cause more trouble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll wait a few days."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She should be here by then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can always attempt to scry, and see if I can check in on her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. Not a bad idea."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. I need a drink."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's get somewhere safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She charges off, looking for the nearest tavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, I guess. I don't know. I forget it's not overrun by vampires, I'm sorry. Sorry, I forgot; it's all right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe somewhere safe, like right here--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like right here, sorry, there's a lot going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zahra and Kashaw looking around expectantly as you continue this conversation. Kash crosses his arms, goes, "Great place. There's a lot of white." Of which Zahra comes and steps over and is like, "Don't worry, darling. (laughter) So, sleeping arrangements, I hope?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, the castle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll be putting you up in the castle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's go for the castle." And they both make their way towards Whitestone Castle, to find a comfortable place to get themselves situated in their new surroundings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we're healed up, we are healed, we are not running the risk of dying at any moment, because we've been healed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is that? What is that blur of green?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a fucking leprechaun, get it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, sorry, sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your shirt, is that new? Because I love it so much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks! But I'm also wearing a tie because it's a special night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. It's a special occasion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sighs) So, is Allura dead? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kima just left, so--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's on her way to a tavern. Kima's drinking it up. Grog! Kima's drinking it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we heading to a tavern?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're heading to the castle. We're going to talk to friends, we're going to take a look at--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Corpse armor, hello.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, corpse armor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You know, the thing that almost killed our friend over here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It did kill me. According to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It-- yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but, I mean, you're here, so you didn't die. But you did. But you didn't. But you did. And then you didn't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. You guys all heading to the castle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You head to the castle. Cassandra isn't there at the moment, but Keeper Yennen is currently there with a few other members of the makeshift council you guys put together towards the end. One of the heads of the entire farming establishment here in Whitestone is with them, and they're having a conversation. As Zahra and Kashaw burst in first, he's like, "I'm sorry, we're not "currently taking visitors, could you-- Oh. Friends of yours, I presume?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good friends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Helpers, actually. They're going to be here for a while. Hopefully.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gracious. Oh, I see you yourself carry the vestments of a man of the cloth. Who brings your "power this day?" Kashaw gives him a look and goes, "You don't even want to know, buddy." Walks past him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a really good Kashaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well! I assume they're staying here as well."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. We appreciate it greatly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They'll be taken care of, Percival."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They will be well worth your time. We also have something that needs a bit of study. We found something. We found two objects of power that we think may help us turn the table against the dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two objects?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is good news."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two objects.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was the second?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a necklace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I must have missed it because I was dead. That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dead?!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a very long day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mostly dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Be very careful when handling this armor, is what we're trying to say.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or don't handle it, and we'll take care of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, the armor is what killed you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, actually, a trap that Percival set off is what killed me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- trap was a bit-- it was a bit, ah-- there was a trap. And it was well-protected.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, what, what? What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, what.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (mutters) He didn't know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? So these Vestiges.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vestiges."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These leathers, these things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Um--" And he puts a couple of small, armored, like, studded-leather gloves on and has to carefully reach out for the vestments as you hand them. And he grabs them. "Give me a bit of "time with them, perhaps, I need to clarify what this enchantment may be. Do you mind staying "around, just in case?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't feel strange that I don't trust this, but, based on your history with it, I would like a "little backup." So, he carries you off down the far hallway, you didn't get this far into Whitestone when you initially came through, but towards the back there was a small study area converted into a research establishment largely set up for the ziggurat beneath the city. He clears off an area of the table and sets this down. And he takes some time working with the vestments before he eventually, and it's this awkward quiet of hearing him mutter to himself and bring out a symbol and bring over a minor enchantment to reveal information, that tearing into the divinity, the divine magic that is granted to him, before he says, "This carries the "mark of the Raven Queen, a very strong mark. I've not seen power like this in but an object."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was worn by one of her champions. The great Purvan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a strange name."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Regardless, it appears that this armor does help fortify one's defenses from any sort of "physical damage, as well as give you a chance of surviving even the most dangerous of near-death "experiences. It also grants a fluid resistance to the elements. Here." And he hands it over, and-- who would like to take this? Item card to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you died for it, you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I like it, but I'll just look at it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's leather?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's leather.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, to give you the specifics on it, it's plus two to AC. Magical on top of the studded leather armor. Plus two enchantment, beyond just the studded leather armor. It does give you advantage on death saving throws.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll need that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it is called the Deathwalker's Ward, and once per short rest, you can set it to be resistant to one of the five types of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You choose which one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You choose. You can change it. You can leave it all on one, but if you want to change it during a short rest, you can shift it from fire or cold, or lightning--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Acid, or necrotic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're, like, indestructible now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have fancy leather armor right now? What does your armor do right now? Anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's acid-resistant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My armor's acid-resistant, I sort of stole it from my brother. Do you want your acid-resistant armor back, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever you want, Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's in such a sour mood lately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, yeah. Well, what about the necklace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The necklace as well?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's something inside this gem."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans) Not again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why do things like living in gems? It can't be comfortable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It might be a worm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like tequila.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't actually ascertain the nature of whatever being is encased within this, but--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a being, it's a being?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Encased.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a soul gem?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like something put it in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's actually a small gateway to a tiny pocket-plane."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A pocket-plane?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It can contain one creature. You have to contact whatever it was, and it can't be too big, "but it can essentially contain something indefinitely within this."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But something's already in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Something is already in this."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Something that we can summon?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any way we can find out what it possibly is before we summon it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, I do not have that capability."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was buried with--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's really smart to give to Scanlan.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, like, you said "not too big" though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The confines of the space, at least, as part of the enchantment, seem rather small. A bit "larger than you, maybe, but not much more than that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, right, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, does it change size?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is maybe the worst thing that Scanlan's ever held outside of that gun that you had, Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you talking about? Can we take it in the woods, open it up, and if it sucks we kill it, and if not, we've got a new pet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't even know how to open it up! Do we know how to open it up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, we will find a way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was buried with the Raven Queen's champion, I mean, it could be incredibly dangerous. Or it could be incredibly good, and he trapped it, and they're bad, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The same could be said about your new pajamas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are so beautiful. I do like feathers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do they smell like?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sniffs) Like (sniffs) must and mold. And birds, really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) And birds? Eesh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, is that all you require of me?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I require Percy to tell us what the fuck's up with the necklace he's reading about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just what he said.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he already told us about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Once we release whatever is inside of it, we can use this necklace as a weapon, to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a cage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To trap people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do we remember from the great Purvan's story?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, let me look at my book?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did he fight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just remember that Purvan's story touched me. Touched me in inappropriate ways.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) No, no, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what I like about this particular piece of paper is that you made it on cardstock so it's extra special instead of the regular paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's legendary.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Legendary cardstock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we get purple cardstock up in here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm talking to Matt, bitches. Okay. I forgot what I was going to say-- Oh, my book! My 30-gold book! Does it say anything about what Purvan fought?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right! You read through. There were many, many things throughout the war that were fought: entities from the Nine Hells, there was a faction of the Abyss that came in as a third bit of evil in this whole conflict; and while not in alliance against the other forces of chaos, there were many forces of chaos lashing out at what was nearby. So the Champion's-- there was no specific entity that was his chosen, or at least, what you can ascertain to be a specific being of hatred, although it does speak of Purvan, the Champion of the Raven Queen, keeping with him an ally.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't say the nature of the ally, it just says the dangerous and respected Galdric.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Galdric.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, there are some options here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that won't work, damn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, say it, come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Except I don't know if we could actually release it down there. I don't know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, what if it touches the thing, and it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's also magic resistance down there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, which means it wouldn't work in the first place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if he's friendly? I mean, he talks about being an ally.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be an ally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well then, wouldn't we want to save it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An ally of Purvan! An ally of Purvan's!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Purvan a good guy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought the Raven Queen was not good!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, the Raven Queen--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's like-- neutral.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I make a roll for this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a religion check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Patty's Day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't kill anybody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, with these green dice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Religion or history?

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS
lines.text: Religion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Many men fear it, and fear her for that reason, and there are those that instead embrace it as the inevitable. As to the true nature of her intent, no one really knows. It's part of her mystique.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, like, even if we let out the glorious Ball-lick or whatever his name is, like, if he's bad, we can't really put him back in, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we actually can. Actually, we can put him back in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, we touch him with it and he goes back in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After a saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we should save him and release him when he'll be valuable to us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So would a trap. We could also trap other creatures--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like a Poké Ball! Right? It's like a Pokémon?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, it's exactly like a Poké Ball.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who knows if he'll go back in willingly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't have to go in willingly, that's sort of the point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I guess you could technically use it that way, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But wouldn't we rather be friendly with him than him be angry at us the next time we release him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm more excited about the idea of carrying around an empty trap.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we could win both. But we could have a trap and a friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think Percy is right that we should let it out now because it's a question mark, no matter what. Whatever, it's all theories. We don't know what we're getting into, and better that it pop out now, on its own, and not while we're facing a fucking beholder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should do it in the forest outside of Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or the forest outside of Whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vasselheim? We're here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we try and do a little bit more research on Galdric first?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would be too careful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, come on. Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex! Just open it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival. Are there any libraries here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not really, anymore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about a personal collection in your family?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Didn't they ravage most of our collection?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Elements have been ravaged. Elements of family history have been destroyed so that there couldn't be large connections, or the end of the bloodline itself being too prominently displayed within the castle itself. There is still a library there, though from your knowledge-- and you've read through most of those books growing up-- a lot of them are loose history books; a lot of them are more encyclopedia-like, general knowledge--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She wasn't a revered deity in this part of the world, we don't have a lot--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, yeah, let's do it. Woods!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Woods! Woods! Woods!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Woods, or Vasselheim, that's actually not a bad idea to get far away from Whitestone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, because then somebody else'll come along and kill it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus they don't like magic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is sort of our secret, and we should perhaps keep this--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we were going to go take a look at--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (muffled) What if--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got shit in your mouth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We g-- mm, sorry. Little bit of saliva.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodberries?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Snacks. We go to those goliath caves, right outside of Whitestone, that were abandoned.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stone giant caves?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Made me feel like I had to poop for a second, there. Goliath caves, fuck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry! I just remembered you recognized them. They were empty, and abandoned, we could go there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that close to your family?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we saw it on the way into Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just a couple hours away, correct?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's, I'd say roughly three, three and a half hours northwest of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's where the forest of the Alabaster Sierras ends and the actual Alabaster Sierra mountain range begins, is where that transitions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can take a day and do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think? Good idea? Good idea?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, yes, yes, yes, Keyleth had a good idea, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're healed, yes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're healed, right? Did we sleep? Do we need to sleep?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought we rested before we went down under the water, though--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we did, we didn't rest since then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't remember resting afterwards. And I was there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't either. I remember I peed on a lake, and then we went under it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I think you guys decided instead of resting to come to rest here in Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we need to sleep, y'all!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take a sleep, and we'll do it in the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What time is it, about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say by now, with as much time as you spent in the temple, from waking up in the morning, it's getting four in the afternoon, five in the afternoon. The sun's starting to come down, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Cure Wounds on myself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't we going to sleep?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it's four in the afternoon! There's other things to do today.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like drink?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like find out how Gilmore's doing and see Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I should probably scry and check in on Allura, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got some work to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you guys. Yeah, and you're starting to push towards the bottom of your ammunition stack anyway, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need to, yeah, to do a little-- and I've got a little thing I want to work on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool. All right, so, who's doing what first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take Vax aside very quickly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do that first!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a careless moment, and I apologize. And you're the first apology I'm putting forward. I don't know if I would have done anything different, but I hope you know that I would've never forgiven myself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What're you talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rushed in and triggered the trap that almost killed your sister.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That killed my sister.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't say that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was careless.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, what happened, Percival?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I felt the danger had passed, and I moved too quickly, and opened the casket without thinking. That's all. I just didn't think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just opened it? Just like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was tired, wasn't thinking. Sometimes we move too quickly. But I want you to know that it would've-- I'm very glad that she's alive, because I don't think I could have lived with myself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Could you do me a favor?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the future-- If there is anything that your little heart desires inside of a box-- In the future, could you check with my sister or myself first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the hope, yes. That was more of a lesson than I was hoping for. Thankfully not too much of one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And none of us are beyond mistakes, but... that is a mistake that I am going to be thinking about for a very long time. We are going into dangerous territory, and we all have to think a little bit more. And she especially, I-- I couldn't--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well listen, Percy. We are not playing a game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we will all make mistakes, and I wager I will make my fair share. I've little doubt. And Percival, I want to apologize. I'm sorry. But-- And I punch him in his know-it-all fucking mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you attempt to move out of the way, or take it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, let's take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (impact sound) Decks you square in the-- for as hefty as a punch it was? Doesn't hurt quite as much as you expected. But it's not the physical pain that hurts, more than the action and the knowledge that there are more repercussions to your rash decision than even you initially anticipated.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodnight, Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goodnight, Vax.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's four in the afternoon! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to work. I'm going into my studio.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, who else wants to do something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where'd Kima go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's not heavy drinking but she's definitely nursing a tankard and quietly contemplating as she sits at the edge of the bar with her hands around the tankard. She's staring at her reflection as she spins it slowly on the wood. You can hear it (scuffing) on the woodgrain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyone else want to go to the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going with you, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's like a few other random patrons, but no one catches your eye. No one specifically.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll come, too. Well, actually, wait. Grog, what're you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nothing yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm with Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the two of you, into the tavern-- she doesn't notice you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up and put my hand on her shoulder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keyleth!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey! How's it going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Better."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I lean up against the bar, next to you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Want to check in on Allura?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's do it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there an empty room around here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks over to the barkeep. You all stare over and the barkeep is currently there like wiping down the bar section. "For how long?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For a couple hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Doesn't need to be that long.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two silver?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We saved your life? And the entire town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are fine to use it as you please for the remainder of the afternoon. Just don't mess it "up, please."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. We'll try really hard to find better things to do with our time. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you make your way up and the place is fairly vacant, there are a couple of rooms that are currently partially-- the doors are ajar and you hear voices in there, and you recognize it's a couple of the refugees that you guys brought over from your keep, currently holed up in this tavern. An inn floor on the second floor. But there are a number of open rooms right now that you could go ahead and step into for use.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just pick one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So. Do you want to go ahead and attempt a Scry ritual?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Focusing on...?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The flower that I gave her before we left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, good call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And from Westruun you can see most of the city, as you recall, and a large portion of it currently looks toppled-over and pushed into ruin. There are no longer burning black clouds, but white smoke, long after a fire or some sort of an impact, lazily drifting off some of those ruins. It focuses even closer, and you see very little populace in the streets. Most everyone's either indoors or not visible at the moment. Your vision clicks in once again, and you can see currently some sort of dark room hidden in Westruun. You see, for a brief instant, a flicker of light, and you see Drake Thunderbrand and Allura both gathering a few small books under their arms, silently waiting, quietly. You hear (impact sounds) some heavy footfalls above. They both just stay quiet, stay quiet. Allura stays still for a moment. She looks over at Drake. They both take hands and then (whoosh) convert into that same energy form you saw that jettisoned out of Greyskull Keep, that echoes down a long hallway that you previously didn't see was attached to this room. It leads to a stone spiral staircase that goes upward before these two dual sparks travel through the small crack between where the edge of a trap door and a wooden floor is as the sparks course upward into the now-setting sun. You can see amongst the sparks the mostly collapsed rubble of the Cobalt Reserve, the large library in the center of Westruun. You can see dozens of corpses that have been largely dissolved. You can see what remnants of their bodies have been eaten away by some sort of caustic material, their arms and fingers tightened up as the muscles pull into this horrible, gnarled visage of what once were the living residents of Westruun. You do see, as the spark comes to a stop for a second in its movement, and you hear briefly overhead (wingbeats) and you see rush overhead, wings fully spread, the black dragon that you had briefly encountered in Emon streak upward, roaring loudly, towards Gatshadow, the tall, dark spire mountain just north of Westruun. (whoosh) And as it heads up there, the sparks (electric sound) continue their trek through the streets, and at that point the ritual fades, its vision unable to maintain its focus. Your vision is pulled back up into the clouds and then thrust back into your current position and with a shock you find yourself back in the tavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you see? Is she all right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's alive, her and Drake both are alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Where are they going?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're at the Cobalt Reserve, which is in ruins, as well as the rest of Westruun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see the dragon?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, the black dragon is there. Looks like he's taken up residence in the black spire-- tower. What was it called?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gatshadow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gatshadow. Allura--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you communicate with her when you scry? I don't know how it works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I can just look in and see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was grabbing the last few important tomes, remnants left from the Cobalt Library, I mean, Reserve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They staying in Westruun?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It didn't look like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Where are they going?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, I didn't see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Did you talk about where you--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We left word. And told her we were coming here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here to Whitestone?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. If you wait, she'll be here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who else is coming?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Drake. Anybody else on the Council coming?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We brought some Council members, right? Were any among our--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not there, you're with Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, Grog! Want to play some bocce ball? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know who all's coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uriel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What about the rest?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: His wife and children are here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here, okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As well as Gilmore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gilmore's Glorious Goods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wonderful place to buy all sorts of products, if it were still... standing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Huh. I've only heard things, I've not met this 'Gilmore'."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You haven't met Gilmore!? Man, I just assume everyone knows each other.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anybody else? Tofor?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, maybe...? Yes, Tofor...?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He might have... been... slain...?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which one is Tofor?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's the dragonborn--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, Tofor-- they did, I think Tofor is-- definitely maybe here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last you heard, two Council members that were confirmed still alive by Gilmore when you found him-- or, confirmed by Uriel's wife and family-- thank you, sorry, were Tofor and Asum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the last you heard of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're looking for other survivors, Tofor and Asum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "In the place where this-- and what's this dragon you keep talking about?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit, you don't know anything. Thordak! Big. Terrible. Red.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you say the name again, you can see her eyes resonate with a clarity, and where once was this very intense expression and air of demanding information suddenly recedes into this look of sudden fear, and she's briefly lost in thought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, you defeated him once. He escaped the Fire Realm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not only did he escape, he tore a giant tear in the rifts between the Fire Realm and ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs deeply) "Thordak." And you can see, she's starting to hyperventilate suddenly, like, for all of her strong exterior, this is the first time, aside from the brief hit of the beholder's ray earlier, you see fear in her eyes, and she starts standing up. (pants) "I need to get some air."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kima, Kima, it'll be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I need to--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sit here, you want to sit down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I need to get s-- I need to get some air." And she storms out of the room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go outside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, Keyleth--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I shut the door behind Kima.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to talk to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would ask my brother, but, knowing him, he would walk away. What happened?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth has a hard time looking her in the eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at me, Keyleth! Be strong! You're royalty. Tell me what happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex, I don't want to ever see you like that again. I don't want to ever see anybody like that again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay? I need you to tell me what happened. Because between us? Vax is off. Something's wrong. And I need to know what it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all watched you die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did I get back? Who brought me back? Kashaw, Zahra, my brother. Anyone else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess... you could say, probably an unseen entity, an unseen force. Oh, I'm lightheaded.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sit down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a bed. Sit down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy helped.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's skip that. When we brought you back, Kashaw performed a resurrection ritual.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like we did with Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. And he called upon a deity and at first he was afraid that it was Vesh. Which he was quite terrified about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His wife.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. That, I don't believe, is the presence that answered his call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Fluttery words here, darling. Get to the point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought I was going to lose you both. I thought I was going to lose you and Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why Vax? Did he get hurt as well? No. What did he do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He-- I don't know. I don't know what he did. He said to take him instead, is what he told the entity. He offered his life for yours. And my biggest fear was that neither of you were going to come back. He offered his life for you. And for all we know, that offer was accepted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I had to guess, it was probably the Raven Queen herself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. It's rather suiting, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He seems to do that quite a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Keyleth? Thank you, dear. And I leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stay behind and burst into tears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Grog and Scanlan! What're you guys doing? (relieved laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Grog voice) Go fish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So-- what do you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. I hadn't really thought about it. Do you have any games with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think there's some orc parts in there that've been in for a couple months.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't sound very fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. I got all nervous when they mentioned a goliath's cave, so I need to go boom-boom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I play a song so no one can hear it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might help. Like, stand guard outside the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. A little muzak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you mind?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's what I'm here for.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go drop some ordnance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you find one of the few local ramshackle outhouses-- none are quite goliath-sized, and it's an uncomfortable experience, but thank God you brought a bard along or you would have woken up half the populace just going to bed, as Scanlan, I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing to see here, everybody! (plays random chords on the harmonica) Nothing to see here!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (coughs, then farts) Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now, the music's playing, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's just a stall, just me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, can I take out Craven Edge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the outhouse? Sorry, keep going!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the palace, this is where all the best thoughts and conversations happen! I don't know how it is at your house.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep in mind how confined it is, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. (grunting)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds like a rough one in there, buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you (chuckles) as you see one of the wood boards splinter out the side for a second--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, yup, that's tacos!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You might want to play a bit louder and maybe take a few steps away, it's about to get violent.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No problem!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that moment you focus, and as you can feel the blade itself grow cold in your fingertips, you can see what little bit of light that filters through the bright orangish-red color that's coming from the sunset, you can see a reflection in the obsidian blade as a voice comes to your ear and says, "You fed me well."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I did, right? I mean, we are really doing well. Question: so, when we were fighting that big Earthbreaker Groot-looking guy, he called you a 'dark weapon'. Does that-- do you have feelings, and did that hurt them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a brief pause before you hear this long, drawn-out, (heavy sigh).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, hold on! No, no, listen. And I take my thumb and I run it against the blade real quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you do, all of a sudden the voice goes, (gasp, contented exhale).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, yep, sorry, listen. So, my question is, as much as I love opening up people to feed you, I want to know, like-- what's in it for you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, are you talking to your shit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, you got to let it know who's boss!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The voice creeps in again, this time. "There is no feeling more terrifying than hunger. And I "hunger forever. You help satiate that hunger. That is our arrangement. I give you the strength of "those you cut down, and I feed upon them. If this is unsatisfactory, I can and have found others who "are more willing to be part of this arrangement--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, no, I'm a big fan, really, I mean, I am yoked out when I'm using you, it's fucking amazing. I mean, people are flying apart, it's like a dream. But listen, can you ever be... full?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have never been full before. Perhaps you're the one to find out."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll bet I am, actually, you're really lucky you found me and not these other blokes, not even half the man I am. But listen, so, there's no, like, endgame, just to be clear, you just want to drink and drink, 'cause I've seen the blood, right? And usually I wipe it off, but you, like, suck it in, and that's a little unsettling, not going to lie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My hunger grows, but the air tarnishes my blade. Perhaps we can continue this conversation "elsewhere."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I sheathe him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you sheathe, the last thing he says is, "Don't forget: I hunger always."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I kick the door open, and I'm like, if you're within 200 feet, back up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one's out here, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just me. Are you all right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I heard you say something about blood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, am I sweating? It was a real workout, that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At some point you said, "Are you full?" Are you talking about-- did you fill it all the way up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the privy, you know, it was starting to give my bum a tickle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You topped it off!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Because, you know, you don't want to, like, dip in the muck, it's, you know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Foul.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you want to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I'm good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure? I warmed it up for you, it's, like, ready to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love a good deuce, but not today, I think.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Fair enough. But I'm feeling so, like, vacated--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should go get a bite.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you're right!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) All right, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys are getting a bite. Percival, if you want to go ahead and make a tinkering check with dexterity modifier to create more ammunition.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tinkering check with dexterity modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should be plus 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. We'll say, in the time that you've had here, with the materials you purchased, and Whitestone's pretty open to supplying you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'd say you're able to create roughly 40 or so simple bullets in the time that you have.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I have time to poke at a modification to the explosive arrow? I want to try and build a rock breaker. I'm curious to try and build an arrow for taking down walls or taking down doors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a siege arrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A light form of siege arrow. Basically, I want to have a tip that actually manages to breach stone and then an explosion that goes outwards, so it's a shattering arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, this'll take the remainder of your evening. You're not going to be able to do much else after this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have nothing else to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make a tinkering check with your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. So... That's 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not at your workshop back at the keep, unfortunately, so you have to work with whatever you have here, and nothing here is designed for the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I've got an okay workshop here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The one that you used before, previously, but that's from mostly discarded and-- in the time that you've been gone, it's been cannibalized for a lot of different uses. But it's makeshift. You manage to complete what you think could function. You're not entirely certain as to what the final effect will be, but it all seems to be in place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can write down 'Explosive Siege Arrow'.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Siege arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we shall find out in time what it does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Siege arrow. That's fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A few things I've been working on, and that's one of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Are you guys resting for the evening? Anything else you wish to accomplish?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would probably be smart. I'm pretty tired after dying, so I'm going to go to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Vax, anything you want to accomplish before you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God, the guilt. Okay. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I buy a torch somewhere? Just a torch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure! Yeah, torches are relatively easy to find. You want to try one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three torches. That's three copper.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bring Trinket into the castle with me, just so you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After all this has happened, Trinket has been, like, almost locked to you. Even you going upstairs into the tavern, Trinket was like, (plaintive bear noises) stayed out front, 'cause Trinket's learned at this point, you can't really go into all the taverns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's hard, it's hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's rough, being a bear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And wherever we're eating, does it happen to be near Jameson the painter's workshop?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but it's about a 20-minute walk, if you wanted to go find him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Be nice to check in with him. Grog, do you mind walking with me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Absolutely not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so we'll truck on over to Jameson's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You head up to it, and this gentleman is a painter as well as a stablehand, so you find your way to the facility, knock on it, and immediately as the door opens, the smell of fresh manure hits your nose and Jameson steps out. "Can I-- you!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! Hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hi!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I meant to deliver, but they told me not to, because apparently it's not there anymore?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The town, you mean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Town, yeah, where I was supposed to deliver it to you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was wise of you to keep this precious artifact here, because it would've surely been destroyed en route or when it arrived--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's just the canvas, I don't have a-- It's a bit too large for my specifications of framing, but--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure it's huge. Did you finish it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, yes! Come, come!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I look?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh please, oh please!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing) Okay, let's go look!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes one of the hooded lanterns and turns up the oil wick on it, and as he turns away he brings you into the back stable area where it's been sectioned off, and you can see there's paints that have been dropped all across the ground and the hay, it's this multicolored spattering, this rainbow vomit across this section of hay floor, and there in all of its glory, stretched across and nailed at the corners to this far, far wall, you see a fantastical landscape of rolling hills and treelines rising up at the edges. You can see a mountainscape in the distance. The lighting he uses is magnificent. You can see why many people in the city specifically requested that you go to this gentleman. There atop this fantastic green hilltop, you see on this fine white and grey steed as it raises up, hooves in the air, is yourself, shirt open, chest slightly fuzzy and muscular. As you look off, your hair blowing in the breeze--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's the face? How's the face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The face is pretty damn spot-on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The best likeness you can find for somebody who only had a brief reference, as he sketched you quickly before he left, and there behind, clutching you, from the side you can see Pike wearing these long greyish-silver and blue robes that are also flowing behind, a long train-- longer than it needs to be, stylistically it was a choice in the artistics point of this-- it is everything you hoped it would be. You paid good money for this piece.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to request-- Grog, I need a minute here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah. I understand, take--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just to weep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take all the time you need.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I regard it for a few minutes, taking in the beauty and the wonder of all I've accomplished--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a question. Would Keyleth and Scanlan be crying in rooms at the same time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now? Yes. For different reasons entirely.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) Somewhere out there...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at the air, look at the air high-five. There it is.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Beneath the pale moonlight

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So white. That was the whitest of white high fives ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm imagining this as a canvas of Lisa Frank majesty, by the way. Like, the greatest Lisa Frank Trapper Keeper cover in all the land.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: After I weep for a few minutes, I thank Jameson again and how much did I pay him for this thing? You've gone above and beyond, Jameson, and I know that you're a humble man and you don't want me to spread word of your accomplishments, but please allow me to write you an epic poem or a song and tell of your artistic gifts and talents, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That would be a fine tip, sir. Please, yes, do so."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll get right on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Send them back to Whitestone, please, ask for Jameson. The more I work this, hopefully I can "make my way out of this dunghole."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry, you'll have lots of commissions after this, I promise you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'm going to give him an extra 50 gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's more than the price of a book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sir, I-- thank you. Thank you, thank you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For art supplies to get your shop up and running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course." He looks down and he's gotten a little bit of paint on the coins, he's like, (muttering and stammering). He puts it aside somewhere. "Thank you--" Wipes his hands off on a nearby rag. "Thank you." And takes your hand and shakes it vigorously.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, can it be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes a good, like, three minutes to roll the thing up, and it's quite heavy as he hands it over to you-- (heavy grunt) In your hand, yeah, it almost takes you off your feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog! Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you hold this for me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's you, I mean, you're so magnificent in it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I can't do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know it-- I really--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog! I watched you shit for an hour!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, all right, I'll pick it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of the blue night sky takes on-- Evening is ready, do you guys have anything else to accomplish before the evening comes to a close?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait 'til it's quiet. And I leave the room that I've been given at Whitestone. And I find my sister's door. And I stand outside it, and I stare at it for a minute--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax? Is that you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I stealth away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I open the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a stealth check, roll a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22. Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing to be seen. Must have been your imagination, Vex.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I wait for the door to close. And then I walk to Keyleth's door. And I knock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a knock at your door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The clomping of horse hooves in the distance, apparently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I open it. Hey. Hi. You okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come in. Sit down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you feel?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. All I know is... that I felt her. I don't know magic, I don't know anything. I open doors, and only when the wind is blowing in the right direction, sometimes, I think. I don't know what happened, but I felt her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you still feel her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check, Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're sitting there, looking down at the ground, as she asks this question, you notice the symbol of Sarenrae that you have stitched into the back of your glove, what was once a very vibrant, goldish-brass color has actually very heavily tarnished, and the metal itself seems to have cracked in three places. It was not this way a day before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I don't know if I did anything in there, and I wouldn't take it back if I did, but I don't know what I'm doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know if it was very noble or very stupid, to be honest. Probably a little bit of both. I can attempt a Greater Restoration spell, and see if I can sense anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll let you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So as you prepare your mindset for the cleansing ritual that is the Greater Restoration--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just lay back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as the dull green energy begins to course across your fingertips, and as you touch the edge of his shoulder to impart his body with the cleansing energy, it courses through his shoulders, the spell completes. You sense no difference in your current physicality, mindset, and there's this pause, this silence, of no realization, that is suddenly shattered by the sound of a (caws). You look over and at the stone edge of the window you guys are staying in, you see stepping there a single dark raven, (clicks, rapid flapping) and it takes off and flies into the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought I was going to lose you. And I'm terrified I'm still going to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, I love you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everything could go phenomenally well. And by becoming Headmaster, we enter a bit of a realm of immortality where I could live for a very, very long time. I'm afraid every time I look at one of your faces that it's going to be the last, and I feel like deep down I know that day is coming. So because of that I'm afraid to let myself feel anything deeper than I already do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I quickly leave her room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door closes behind Vax.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And for the second time today Keyleth bursts into tears. Why do people keep leaving me in rooms alone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop it, you're wasting water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're in a drought, god damn it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When was the last time you showered, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's been a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Makeup's runny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go water elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the only way. All right, as you all find yourself coming to rest for the evening, some of you easier than others, eventually you get your full rest. Those who heal up to, say, full hit points for a good night's rest here, get your hit dice back, so not a whole lot were spent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I lose my strength bonuses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Morning comes to you all, and-- yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, just one detail. From there, I went and fell asleep in this idiot's doorway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [break]

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt, shit on my face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everybody!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's too close!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They caught it, that one caught it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was pretty close.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All they heard was "ace."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good. Welcome back, guys. We're going to go ahead and jump back in. So as you all, after that, for some, emotional evening, whether that be conversational emotion or, you know, having to go drop an emotional deuce. You know, that's important. You find yourselves waking up to a fresh morning in Whitestone, hints of blue sky breaking through the cloud coverage, and that's rare for this area because it's the northern portion of the continent, you know that, especially being so close to the ocean, a lot of the cloud, heavy precipitation makes its way in the direction of your town, so it's nice to have a little break in that. Nonetheless, as you guys come to consciousness and gather yourselves, your things, and your plans for the day, what do you wish to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are a city of seasonal affectation disorder, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I open my door and find my brother falling through it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm awake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Comfortable bed, I see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Sorry, I couldn't find my room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's confusing, all these, all these doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What time's it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have no idea. My nature check tells me it's roughly, I dunno, eight? Nine? Something like that. Seven? Maybe seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come here, you shithead. Don't fucking do that again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not like I did it on--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't fucking do that again, all right? Just don't fucking do it again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't breathe. You're about to kill me again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll live, you'll live. Jesus. Whoever that is.

lines.name: LAURA
