lines.text: As we're walking up, I fall behind and I slip Vax the potion of fire protection.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys continue in pace with this, eventually, and make another perception check?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Much better, that's a natural 19. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30. Okay. Looking up, as this cluster of individuals makes their way towards the very top of the mountain, seemingly not taking sight of your traveling group, you're beginning to see the nature of each section of this flow cooling. And what you're seeing is the group will move up a bit, stop, and there appears to be a burst of-- sometimes it looks like very strong wind, sometimes it looks like a very localized sleet storm that is brought against the side of the mountain and is actually forcefully cooling the flow down temporarily, at least in those sections, before it begins to spill over and continue its slow molten descent, but they're doing their best to continue to force it back up the mountain and--

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Those are druids.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Skywrite in the clouds above us, in the smoke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I write--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "So, how are you guys doing up there?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Hi."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Hi. Hey you guys." I write, in druidic symbols, "Keyleth, Kaitiaki."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that? Is that her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You notice the pace in which this group has ascended comes to a halt at the very, very top of the mountain range where it ends, and there's a slight pause before the clouds shift a second time and it says, from what you understand, "Kaitiaki. Survivors remain, Keyleth."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I respond with, "Help has arrived."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys are texting?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Druid texting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you saying?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop looking at your phone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do they say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we go over there and talk to them?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're survivors.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they nice?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're survivors. What does it matter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go. And I tell them, you know, "Arriving. Stand down. Here we come."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Lol."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Lol. Winky-face."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As we travel, because I was too out of it to respond and she's way ahead, I take the potion that Keyleth gave to me, because she didn't have to, I've got the David Bowie armor on now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did don it. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, yeah. Before going to bed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh you did, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I press it into Vex's hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, I took your, all right, I'm going to take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was your choice of resistance? I assume it was fire. Okay. All right. As you guys progress up, and it is, though it is a safe route, it is still a relatively steep incline and you're all having to work together to find handholds, and it is very arduous physically getting up there. I would like everyone to go ahead and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A constitution?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, do we get advantage because of the feast?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's only wisdom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Colville meteorite die.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm so weak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, jade.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You motherfucker!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you, Matthew Colville.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm rolling my giant jade dice, because it's green.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Way to announce it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Womp-womp. Oh, that's a six.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) You're fucked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys begin to get partially up the mountain, the proximity of the heat from the-- because the exterior of the rock has cooled, but it's still molten beneath and there are parts of that are still cracking open, and bits of the heat are still pouring through, plus the general physical exertion from the not-very-hardy physiques of both Vex and Scanlan, you both suffer one level of exhaustion from the ascent up the side of this mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Trinket's in his thing, he's not worried at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't actually know what one level of exhaustion is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have disadvantage on ability checks. All your skill checks right now, until your next long rest, are at disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Levels of exhaustion suck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not saving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, as you guys are approaching towards the top, you can see now the humanoids that were at the top of this mountain crest have been since keeping the flow at bay and each time it begins to crest over again and continue its flow, it's blasted again from the side and cools and it's building this very, very slow gradual outcropping--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I use my cantrip Gust and cool areas alongside as we ascend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You glance up and you now have a better view of this group, and what you do see ahead of you, specifically Keyleth, appears to be a cluster of about eight or so Fire Ashari-dressed individuals. You can't make out their physical details yet. Along with five other entities that are dressed in the colors and vestments of those from Zephrah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: From who? From what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's up? What's happening?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I run up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth goes running up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said seven or eight from Zephrah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are five from Zephrah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to, we're going to follow?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm breaking out of stealth and running.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah. Yeah. No. We're running now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk. I'm pretty tired. You and me. Let's just walk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. You can carry me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cardio. God.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks a little rough, but she's definitely in one piece. The other one that greets you, and immediately you recognize as Flamespeaker Cerkonos, who currently does not have his right arm. It is charred and is, through some semblance of flame, cauterized to where he no longer has a shoulder and part of his torso is a black mass of burnt skin, probably intentionally, but as you approach he puts his hand out and goes, "Hail, Keyleth."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hail, Cerkonos. And I run up and give him a hug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pats you on the back and there's a coldness to his look, his expression. You can see in a brief instant, though there is strength and determination, there is a moment as he looks into your face that you can see the sorrow of losing most of his people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I look back at him and I say: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are the able-bodied few you see."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are these all that have survived?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We helped outsiders too long ago."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? What do you mean, like, how long ago? 12, 15 years?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We helped seal a drake in this rift."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thordak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is the name they call him. We helped bring and bind the beast to this rift, sealing "within it the heart of a primordial flame, one of the few pure essence crystals of our plane. Such a "binding will not allow it to leave. It is a punishment for the most terrible of evils that the "Ashari take under their order. We carved from the crystal in bind. This beast was too strong and "took the entire crystal, but it seemed enough. It seemed enough."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cerkonos, it's not your fault. There are greater forces at work here, beyond us. That's something that I am desperately trying to reassure myself of every day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a voice comes up from over the mountain range, raspy, older, and with a casual importance to it, and it says, "So, are you claiming some semblance of dealing with this?" And as it steps over, the face looks down with recognition. "My god. Keyleth."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys look up and you see long, silver-haired half-elf in later years dressed in the blue and white robes of the Air Ashari. You see before you Korren, your father. "You live."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He steps forward and goes in, as he steps away from Cerkonos, takes you in his arms and holds you extremely tight against him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry I didn't check in sooner. I didn't want you to be disappointed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shh." He puts his finger up to your lips, holds you back and looks you over and with a smile on his face, you can see the hardness of his expression fade. "Keyleth, you've grown."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot's happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You look just like her."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't found Mom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Her path was her own. I'm just glad that you have maintained yours." He wipes the tear from your face and says, "How goes the Aramente?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's kicking ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Good." And he places his thumb at the corner of his eye. "We were called naught but a "day ago by the surviving Pyrah. Told of the angry mountain and the terrible drake that sundered the "rift. I helmed the team while the majority of our people stayed to keep Zephrah cloaked and safe "from the marauding beast. We've only just made our way up the mountain. Your arrival is quite "fortuitous, as we need all the help we can get."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How can we be of assistance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Come. See what remains of Pyrah." He turns around and walks back over towards the top of the mountain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Daddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He stops. Looks over his shoulder towards you. "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's good to see you again, father.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Undaunted, your father and the other Ashari continue walking forward with no words.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Question. Your majesty? I want to help, we all want to help as much as possible, but I don't know any magic. Most of us don't. Are we going to be able to do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I certainly hope so. If you've survived this long with my daughter, you've picked "up a few tricks."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that I have.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Father, I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for these people. They are the most capable that I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is good. Because that's who we need right now."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: However, since we're druids, we're a little bit more, you know. Geared. Prepared to deal with the fire. I can cast Protection from Energy on a couple of these people, if you wouldn't mind maybe grabbing the other two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will do what I can."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I cast Protection from Fire on Percy, you have it, you have it, do you have it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I really don't even know what I'm going to do here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, it's going to protect you from fire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hit me, babe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do Percy and Scanlan. Father, can you--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a concentration spell, so you can only really have one person going, and that's your concentration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can only have one person going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could cast it at higher levels. Can I cast it at higher levels?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take a mulligan on this one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can't do that with this one? Fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do Scanlan. Do Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm fine, don't worry about me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm going to cast it on myself, for starters. Because I want it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I'm going to cast Protection from Fire on myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does a potion of fire resistance do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The same thing?

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Halves all fire damage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As the cluster of you begin stepping deeper into the caldera, you begin to approach the outskirts of the remnants of the Pyrah tribe's homestead. You can see where most of it has been either completely burnt to a cinder or lies tattered by some great force, shattered. And you start, as you're walking through, you can see where the landscape itself, all the jagged bits of black obsidian glass are shooting up out of the ground and there's broken pieces of the dark rock and volcanic material, and it isn't until your eyes begin to focus that you realize that elements of this rock is not rock at all but the twisted and charred remains of the Pyrah that didn't escape in time, blending in with the ground and landscape surrounding. The rest of the Ashari continue pushing forward, not taking notice, focused, as before you, you can see the rift, still blinking ever-bright, in the center of the remains of the Cindergrove. You steel yourselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn and I look at them and nod and follow in my people's footsteps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll end tonight's session.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. We're cooking with gas now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As Marisha collapses in a pool of tears.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cry more, cry more!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You knew this was coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, man. You're going to have a headache tomorrow, dude.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so tired. I'm tired.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, we've got exhaustion, Sam. That's balls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's not great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks for tuning in to Therapy Thursday, everyone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where we take shits and talk to swords.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got a little bit of column A, little bit of column B, we got some drama, we got some personal issues, we got some reunions, we got some hardships, we got--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wild animals.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so many things!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a travel method for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, I'm so excited about it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I wasn't sure how you guys were going to use that one, as soon as you mentioned it I was like, all right, that's what they're doing. That's a way to do it. Yeah. Well cool, guys, we'll be back next week Thursday with Chris Hardwick, who will be joining us as a guest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How is he going to be here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As himself. He's going to be playing himself, it's going to be very exciting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Guys, I'm a human. Usually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm super busy, I'm super busy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Out of the rift suddenly comes Chris Hardwick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super busy, but I'm super successful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll help save the world, but I got like 50 things on my schedule.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have Critmas coming up, probably end up being that night, maybe another night that week, we'll have details coming up soon, we're trying to figure out the schedule on that. This'll be our big 50th anniversary Critmas blowout, and then we're going to scale it back to like an annual-type event it looks like, both to save the people who work this channel Thursday nights and stay super later to get here, to save the length of the episodes, and to help all of us who have to then go to work sometimes very early the next morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We love you, but I need to sleep. It's as simple as that. We love you, and we love Critmas, but it's a health thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what we'll be doing is this will be our big blowout Critmas, we'll still do it probably for the holidays, and we really implore you guys to give to charities, send us stuff, we still read them, we'll still do Periscopes, those of us who get gifts, some of us will open them on Periscope for you, so we'll still have the interaction, we'll have to do it on our own time and not at 11, midnight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On a 7AM call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So this'll be our big general blowout. So if you're planning something for the next Critmas, this'll be the one to get it in for. But yeah, you can check out the guide to Critmas on Geek & Sundry, it has a list of all our supported charities if you want to give there. It's highly recommended. Thank you guys so much for those who donated to 826 tonight so we can go ahead and help out the Seattle branch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 826 Seattle! We love you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And yeah. Do we have anything else?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Happy St. Patty's Day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys are hopefully sitting at home being very good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For fuck's sake, take an Uber.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys. Well, have a wonderful night, and is it Thursday yet? Bye!
